image.altText: Woman holds hand to face as another consoles her, police in background

props.synopsis: Fifteen victims have died, including a 10-year-old girl, after a terror attack on a Jewish festival at Sydney's Bondi Beach. One of two alleged gunmen has also died, while a further 38 people are in hospital. Follow live.

title.children: Terror attack at Bondi Beach

image.altText: A close-up of a man with dark hair and blue eyes.

props.synopsis: Country music star Lee Kernaghan, powerful business person Mick Burns, traditional owner Brian Tipungwuti and media heavyweight Nick Fordham all provided character references for celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright ahead of his sentencing, court documents show.

title.children: The high-profile people who wrote character references for Matt Wright

image.altText: A photo of an Indigenous man looking directly at the camera with Indigenous mural in background.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has won big at this year's Australian Human Rights Awards, winning three out of the five categories including the top honour which was awarded to Arrernte man, William Tilmouth.

title.children: Stolen Generations survivor wins national human rights award

image.altText: A male teacher with a cap on sits at a desk with an Aboriginal girl who is reading in a classroom.

props.synopsis: An educator says books that reflect remote Indigenous cultures and lifestyles are "the key to success" in improving reading outcomes for First Nations students.

title.children: How the right books can help build remote Indigenous students' reading skills

image.altText: A young Indigenous man crouching on sandy beach, holding green fishing line ring holder, black t-shirt, camo shorts.

props.synopsis: This remote East Arnhem land community is home to 50 permanent residents. There's no shop and only one road in or out. And its unconventional approach to teaching is keeping kids in the classroom.

title.children: Teaching on country in remote East Arnhem Land

image.altText: William Johns is an insurance claims advocate and founder of Claim Right.  He sits in his Sydney office in a navy blue suit.

props.synopsis: The regulator has found that while some superannuation funds have improved insurance claims response times, others are still falling short, with long delays in relation to mental health claims.

title.children: Super funds accused of delaying insurance claims

image.altText: Celine Cremer smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: One of the key searchers involved in the renewed search for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer has told of the emotion and excitement when her mobile phone was found, two and a half years after she disappeared in Tasmania.

title.children: Searcher tells of 'emotion, excitement' when Celine Cremer's phone found

image.altText: Medicinal cannabis plantations

props.synopsis: There doesn't seem to be much political mileage for the government to do anything at all — whether that is cracking down and forcing cannabis users back onto the black market or fully legalising the substance.

title.children: Australia's medicinal cannabis situation is unattractive for politicians

image.altText: 2025-11-17T125307Z_741427822_RC2CYHAFXUU6_RTRMADP_3_UKRAINE-CRISIS-FRANCE-MACRON

props.synopsis: Ukraine relinquishes its ambition of joining the NATO military alliance in exchange for Western security guarantees as a compromise to end the war with Russia.

title.children: Ukraine drops ambitions to join NATO ahead of peace talks

image.altText: A man and a woman in blue lab clothing look at a brain scan on a computer.

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest brain research centre sues one of its executives, alleging he deleted troves of commercially sensitive information during a midnight incursion at its Melbourne laboratory.

title.children: Brain research centre sues executive, alleging he stole and erased files

image.altText: A grey-haired man stands wiith his arms crossed at a residential contruction site.

props.synopsis: Police say a warrant has been issued for the man's arrest in relation to the matter.

title.children: Gold Coast builder gobsmacked as alleged scammer claims to be his nephew

image.altText: A photo of stormclouds above a city

props.synopsis: Parts of south-east Queensland can expect a slight easing of summer heat early this week, with the Bureau of Meteorology forecasting a 6C drop in some areas.

title.children: Dreary weather to take sting out of south-east Queensland heat

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: Growing unease about the valuation of tech stocks drove Wall Street lower on Friday, with the ASX set to follow suit today. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street stumbles on tech sell-off, ASX set to fall

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: What has led to the scrutiny on ASX Limited?

CBA hit with anti-money laundering fine in NZ

image.altText: Leila Jeffreys sits side on to the camera and holds her camera to her eye.

props.synopsis: Over the past four decades, the Australian Antarctic Arts Fellowship has given creatives the opportunity to travel south and develop works on the icy continent.

title.children: 'Magic happens in Antarctica': The creative program taking artists to the ice

image.altText: GettyImages-2251821666

props.synopsis: With England pinning its hopes on victory in the third Test, the tourists have been warned that the Adelaide pitch is not as friendly as it looks.

title.children: Data shows Adelaide pitch is not as friendly as it looks for England

image.altText: A young woman with red hair a white striped top and overalls looks off to the side of the screen, video game screenshot

props.synopsis: There are games to suit everyone, and overwhelmingly Australians are a game-playing nation. Here are some of the most important titles released this year.

title.children: Hollow Knight to Donkey Kong: Our favourite video games of 2025

image.altText: Harold Holt spearfishing off the Great Barrier Reef in 1967.

props.synopsis: Do you have the answers for our This Week in History quiz?

title.children: History quiz: The first Simpsons episode, a missing PM and a new puzzle

image.altText: A man walks through a snow storm

props.synopsis: It has been a busy year for search and rescue operations in the Tasmanian high country. Authorities say a concerning number of visitors to the state's famous national parks are ill-prepared for the fickle weather — even during summer.

title.children: 'Heels, a mini skirt and tank top': Warning for 'summer' hikers in Tasmania

image.altText: A large modern-looking building stands three storeys above the street

props.synopsis: A Victorian tribunal will investigate whether Mallee Family Care and Mildura Rural City Council could have breached planning permit rules.

title.children: Parking spat involving new Mildura family care centre heads to VCAT

image.altText: A cricketer in bright orange plays a sweep shot with white ball in view

props.synopsis: Cooper Connolly leads the Scorchers to victory as star Sixers recruit Babar Azam struggles in the BBL curtain raiser at Perth Stadium.

title.children: Connolly stars as Scorchers down Sixers in BBL opener

image.altText: A Hurricanes WBBL batter plants her front foot and sends the ball towards the midwicket boundary.

props.synopsis: Elyse Villani has described the Hurricanes' win as a "fairy tale" ending to her WBBL career.

title.children: Hurricanes captain Elyse Villani retires victorious after 11 seasons

image.altText: Kendrick holds hit hat and microphone, looking down standing on stage.

props.synopsis: American rap superstar Kendrick Lamar brought the house down at Spilt Milk in Canberra, but it was his interaction with a nine-year-old superfan that stole the show.

title.children: 'We were just crying': Kendrick Lamar serenades 9yo at Spilt Milk

image.altText: images of people projected onto a building at night.

props.synopsis: As Victoria's treaty begins, the Wotjobaluk Nations mark their own celebrations of 20 years since native title recognition.

title.children: Wotjobaluk Nations Festival marks 20 years of native title

image.altText: Michelle Rowland gives a press conference.

props.synopsis: Attorney-General Michelle Rowland is told to repay a portion of travel expenses she claimed for a 2023 family trip to Perth.

title.children: Attorney-general to repay family travel expenses

image.altText: A building with a sign on top saying "Karratha Airport".

props.synopsis: The City of Karratha has applied to the federal government for international airport status in a move that has been welcomed by residents.

title.children: Karratha residents hopeful as council bids for international airport

image.altText: A women in a black shirt and multi coloured hat, sits in the shade as the suns hit a table next to her.

props.synopsis: Data obtained by the ABC shows people are waiting months, if not years, for dental care in every Australian state and territory due to the cost.

title.children: 'It's cooked': Big Brother contestant quit so she could afford the dentist

image.altText: Yellow spray paint markings on a road in front of a suburban shopping strip.

props.synopsis: Police say a vehicle struck a group of pedestrians on Saturday night.

title.children: Driver charged with attempted murder after 'unbelievable' alleged hit-and-run

image.altText: A crowd at a Lionel Messi appearance.

props.synopsis: Indian football fans ripped up seats and invaded the pitch in Kolkata as Lionel Messi's first appearance in India took a chaotic and dangerous turn.

title.children: Chaos as Indian fans riot at Lionel Messi appearance

image.altText: A fire truck and other emergency vehicles ablaze in red and blue lights on a wet street at night.

props.synopsis: Could artificial intelligence speed up emergency responses by receiving a caller's video or smartwatch data and capturing words like "knife" and "collision"? Most people think so and welcome the technology's potential, a survey finds.

title.children: AI on a Triple Zero call? Australians are open to that

image.altText: A banner reading 'Coles' and, in the background, the Woolworths logo.

props.synopsis: Lower grocery bills are being promised within this new ban on price gouging, but giant retailers say they are the ones feeling the pinch.

title.children: Coles and Woolworths hit back at government's price gouging ban

image.altText: A man wearing a Surf Rescue uniform stands on a beach in front of other lifesavers

props.synopsis: As the country heads into the summer holidays, experts are again warning Australians to be aware of swim safety at beaches, pools and other waterways.

title.children: With record drownings, here's what experts say will save lives

image.altText: girl holds mobile phone in front of face

props.synopsis: Online short-form video has shifted from a light distraction to a constant backdrop in many children's lives. But they were never built with children in mind, although many children use them daily.

title.children: How short videos could be rewiring kids' brains

image.altText: A headshot of a young woman with blonde hair looking off camera.

props.synopsis: Tasmania Police says it will formally join the independent search for missing Belgian woman Celine Cremer, after her mobile phone was found by a private search party on Saturday.

title.children: Tasmania Police to join renewed search for missing tourist Celine Cremer

image.altText: Police cars outside a Brown University building.

props.synopsis: Police detain a "person of interest" in connection with the Brown University shooting that left two students dead and another nine people wounded.

title.children: Two students dead, person of interest detained after shooting at Brown University in US
